ygData.subject: Re: Camping, a solution
ygData.msgSnippet: Here is an idea that may solve  camping.  I agree with your analysis as to why there is so much camping. Because these items always spawn on the same NPC, why
ygData.messageBody:
Here is an idea that may solve camping. I agree with your analysis as to
why there is so much camping. Because these items always spawn on the same
NPC, why not ,make the item spawn random? Make sure it still spawns on an
NPC of the same lvl, but in a different Zone. The Tommy may spawn in HH one
time, then in Oasis the next and so on. That way it will be difficult to
know when and were something will turn up.

-----Original Message-----
From: Jason Coan [mailto:COANJ@...]
Sent: Tuesday, May 25, 1999 1:19 PM
To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
Subject: [warriors_eq] Camping


From: "Jason Coan" <COANJ@...>

Its Verant that created the campers. They have made it so that the good
items only spawn once in a great while. These items are worth having, and
worth spending time to obtain. So when I get strong enought to get any
particular item I really really want, I camp the monster that drops it until
I get one, and chances are that there will be someone else in my party that
needs the item to, so we have to camp until they get one too, THEN we move
on.

I do admit camping is a serious problem in the game. But mainly the problem
is that there are so many guilds who FARM items for their lower level guild
buddies. By farming I mean camping getting their item, camping, camping,
camping, getting their item, camping camping camping, (loop), until they
have enough to give their entire guild.

Fine example was last night in Cazic, a SK and a couple caster types were
camping for rubicite gloves. It was rather obvious when they actually got
them because the SKs gloves turned red. The gloves are the only item that
this particular mob drops. After getting his gloves he continued to camp.
Now why did he need to camp there after he got his item? THATS where the
camping problem is.

I've purposed this solution to verant on their internal beta testing beta
board which the general public does not have access to, but nobody from
verant even bothered to reply:

Simply make it so that the higher level items can only be looted once by any
given player, perhaps twice (so they can have one for trading purposes), or
4 times for items that you can use 2 of, ie earrings, rings, bracers, 1h
weapons.


>>> James Wofford <James.Wofford@...> 5.25.99 12:54:03 PM >>>
From: James Wofford <James.Wofford@...>

Why camp him? Why not just see if hes there, if he isnt, move on to other
adventures. Campers are what makes this game untolerable sometimes. The
only camping I do anylonger is camping in with a group that I pull for. And
thats just normal mobs, nothing that you have to wait for a spawn on. Come
on poeple, camping ruins alot of what this game is intended to be, an
ADVENTURE.

Camping for a little while is not as bad as the poeple who simply camp a
place to farm the item over and over again. I can actually understand doing
it for one person who needs the item. But doing it for money and such is
completely inappropriate IMO.

Dyvim Kincaid
Stormriders of Cazic Thule
